trial_identification.studytitle: Salt, obesity, endothelial function and cardiovascular disease risk study 2007
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A 4 week cross-over study investigating the effects of a low salt diet compared to a normal salt diet on blood pressure and vascular function.
trial_identification.secondaryid: Commonwealth Scientific Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO): ad29a

interventions.interventions: dietary intervention study with a low salt diet (50mmol per day)as the treatment. Volunteers will crossover to both treatments as randomly allocated with no washout between interventions.Participants are on either diet for 2 weeks, then immediately cross-over to the other intervention.
interventions.comparator: Normal salt diet (150mmol per day) as the control.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Flow Mediated Dilatation (FMD): Using an ultrasound machine, we will assess the ability of the upper arm artery to become larger after being blocked with an external blood pressure cuff blown up to 250mm Hg for 5 minutes.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline, 2 weeks and 4 weeks.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 30 overweight and obese men and women (Body Mass Index 27-40kg/m2) Systolic blood pressure between 130 and 160 mmHg will be selected. weight stable over the previous 6 months.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Known metabolic disease such as liver or kidney disease, hypertension systolic Blood pressure>160 mmHg Cardiovascular disease Active weight loss in preceding 6 months

trial_design.concealment: Allocation was concealed when it was done by central randomisation by computer
trial_design.sequence: Random allocation using computer software clinstat

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of the study is to find out what the effect of a low salt diet compared to a normal salt diet has on blood pressure and vascular function measured by ultra sound in overweight people who are at risk of heart disease.
